716851f-a.title: Manhattan: Broad Street - Exchange Place
716851f-a.text:
Broad Street, east side, from Exchange Place to Wall
Street (left), showing prominently the massive Mills Bldg.
Adjoining same on the far side is the Drexel, Morgan Bldg.
The open street in the foreground is the well known Curb
Market. Note the U. S. Sub-treasury at the extreme left.
This photo is an enlargement from an original lantern slide.
Circa 1890
Gift of Russell Freeman
New York Public Library
716851f-a.folder: Broad Street & Exchange Place, Manhattan, NY

716859f-a.title: Manhattan: Broad Street - Exchange Place
716859f-a.text:
Broad Street, east side, north across Exchange Place, to
EEEETTTEEEETE
Street, where appears tne Colonial U. S. Sub Treasury.
Beyond that point, this thoroughfare continues as Nassau
Street. The New York Stock Exchange is on the right,
tho not included in this view.
The massive Mills Building was erected in the 188O's and
removed in 1926 for the 38 story Equitable Trust Building.
About 1890-5
J. S. Johnston, photo
Gift of Urbrock Collection
716859f-a.folder: Broad Street & Exchange Place, Manhattan, NY

716848f.title: Manhattan: Broad Street - Exchange Place
716848f.text:
Eroad Street, west side, north from Exchange Place,
across Wall Street, to Pine Street. Progressively
shown are five structures that are identified as the,
Blair, Mackay, New York Stock Exchange, Wilks, Bankers
Trust (under construction) and the Henover National
Bank buildings.
1911
Gift of Urbrock Collection

716850f-a.title: Manhattan: Broad Street - Exchange Place
716850f-a.text:
Broad Street from and including Exchange Place to and including
Vall Street, also showing 1-27 Nassau Street, west side, from Wall to
Cedar Streets. On the right, the buildings are: The MMills Building.
the Drexel, Morgan & Company Buildings and the United States Sub-Treasury
Building, on Wall Street on the site of Federal Hall. On the left, with
the columns, is the New York Stock Exchange. On the street, in the fore-
ground, is the Curb Exohange. This exchange met in the street before
its building was erected.
About 1895r
A9NeAg5
Yurts Brothers.
716850f-a.folder: Broad Street & Exchange Place, Manhattan, NY

716852f-a.title: Manhattan: Broad Street - Exchange Place
716852f-a.text:
Broad Street from and including Exchange Place to and
including Wall Street, also showing the west side of Nassau Street
from Wall to Cedar Streets. In the centre, the 38-story E,uitable
Trust Company Building 1s being erected on the site of the old
Mills Building, built in the 1880's. above it, on 4all treet, is
the Sub-Treasury Building, built in 1842 on the site of the old
Federal Hall, where the Federal Government of the United States was
inaugurated and George iashington inducted as the nation's first
president. In the left background may be seen the New York Stock
Exchange, on the S.W. corner of Broad and aall Streets. cross from
it between the E,uitable Trust excavation and the Sub-Treasury, 1s
the building of J.P. Morgan & Company.
1926.
Brown Brothers.
716852f-a.folder: Broad Street & Exchange Place, Manhattan, NY

716854f-a.title: Manhattan: Broad Street - Exchange Place
716854f-a.text:
Broad Street, west side, north from but not including Exchange Place,
to and including Wall Street. The view also shows Nassau Street, (6
continuation of Broad Street,north of Wall Street) west side, north from
and including Wall Street, to, but not including Maiden Lane.
About August 1926.
Brown Brothers.

716855f-a.text:

716891f-b.title: Manhattan: Broad Street - Exchange Place
716891f-b.text:
(1)
23 to 1 Broad Street, east side, north from Exchange Place (right)
to Wall Street, showing the lower stories of the 38 story Equitable Build-
ing, No. 11-23, at the N.E. corner of Exchange Place. The low structure
adjacent to same is the J. P. Morgan B Co. Building and bears No. 1-9.
The latter is at the S.E. corner of Wall Street. Partdally shown on the
extreme right is the 2i stor Broad Exchange Building, No. 25-33, at the
S.E. corner of Exchange Place.
September 16, 1931.
P. L. Sperr..
(2)
The same, showing onl the upper portions of buildings concerned.
Acros the background appear the Bank of Manhattan and the 60 Wall Tower.
The latter uncompleted.
September 16, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.

716860f-a.title: Manhattan: Broad Street - Exchange Place
716860f-a.text:
Broad Street, north across Exchange Place, showing the
Curb Market in action. The various brokers and traders
transact their business in the street and signal results
to their office associates in the fore ground buildings.
Subsequently they will erect a building to house this
oxchange. At the left are, the Johnston, Blair, Mackay,
N. Y. Stock Exchange, Gillenden, and Hanover Trust Bldgs.
View 2 eliminates the first mentioned structure and in-
cludes a glimpse of the U. S. Sub Treasury on the right.
About 1900's
October 1904
Thomas W. Kennedy, photo
Thru Beecher Ogden
Museum Photographers Assn.
George L. Balgue, photo
716860f-a.folder: Broad Street & Exchange Place, Manhattan, NY

716865f-a.title: Manhattan: Broad Street - Exchange Place
716865f-a.text:
Broad Street, north from a point between Beaver St.
and Exchange Place, and across the latter to Wall Street.
Both of these views show the curb market that operates
here below Exchange Place. To the left are a number of
prominent structures, that are progressively, the John-
ston, Blair, Mackay, N. Y. Stock Exchange, . ilks, Gillen-
den and Hanover Trust Buildings. View 2 is identical,
with the exception of the obvious replacement of the Gil-
lenden by the Bankers Trust Bldg. Note the glimpse of
the U. S. Sub Treasury shown.
No. 1: April 1906
2: 1911
George L. Balgue
716865f-a.folder: Broad Street & Exchange Place, Manhattan, NY
